apiVersion.description: API version with MAJOR, MINOR and PATCH version.

apiReleased.description: The date when this API version was published.

apiDocumentation.description: A link to the current API documentation.

apiChangelog.description: A link to the API changelog.

apiStatus.description: The state or status of the API according to lifecycle management. For example. alpha, beta, active, deprecated, retired or decommissioned.

key.description: Unique key that is a combination of AreaType and FeatureId

skip.description:
Ignores the specified number of items and returns a sequence starting at the item after the last skipped item (if
any)

take.description: Returns a sequence containing up to the specified number of items. Anything after the count is ignored

totalCount.description: Total number of records matching the query

key.description: Unique key that is a combination of AreaType and FeatureId

eventMonths.description: Event month range start date => end date

hasAnyTriggeredVerificationRuleWithWarni.description: Has any Triggered Verification Rule with Warning

speciesFactsIds.description: Ids of Species Facts connected to Taxon

occurrenceRecordedByInternal.description: Internal field used for searches by Artportalen, contains extra user information.

occurrenceVerifiedByInternal.description: Info about users verifying the observation

locationPresentationNameParishRegion.description: The original presentation name for ParishRegion from data provider.

parentLocality.description: Name of parent location, if any.

reportedByUserId.description: User id of the person that reported the species observation.

incrementalHarvested.description: True if sighting was incremental harvested.

triggeredObservationRulePromptRuleId.description: Triggered observation rule promt rule id

triggeredObservationRuleRegionalSighting.description: Triggered observation rule regional sighting state

Cloudiness.description: States the cloud condtions during the survey event.

CompassDirection.description: States the wind direction during the survey event as a compass direction.

eventID.description: An identifier for the  set; of information associated with an Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data  set;.

parentEventID.description: An identifier for the broader Event that groups this and potentially other Events.

fieldNumber.description: An identifier given to the event in the field. Often serves as a link between field notes and the Event.

eventDate.description: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context.

eventTime.description: The time or interval during which an Event occurred.

startDayOfYear.description: The earliest integer day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

endDayOfYear.description: The latest integer day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

year.description: The four-digit year in which the Event occurred, according to the Common Era Calendar.

month.description: The integer month in which the Event occurred.

day.description: he integer day of the month on which the Event occurred.

verbatimEventDate.description: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for an Event.

habitat.description: A category or description of the habitat in which the Event occurred.

samplingProtocol.description: The names of, references to, or descriptions of the methods or protocols used during an Event.

sampleSizeValue.description: A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

sampleSizeUnit.description: The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

samplingEffort.description: The amount of effort expended during an Event.

fieldNotes.description: One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of notes taken in the field about the Event.

eventRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the Event.

geologicalContextID.description:
An identifier for the set of information associated with a GeologicalContext (the location within a geological context, such as stratigraphy). 
May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

earliestEonOrLowestEonothem.description:
The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic eon or lowest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") 
attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

latestEonOrHighestEonothem.description:
The full name of the latest possible geochronologic eon or highest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") 
attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

earliestEraOrLowestErathem.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic era or lowest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

latestEraOrHighestErathem.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic era or highest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

earliestPeriodOrLowestSystem.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic period or lowest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

latestPeriodOrHighestSystem.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic period or highest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

earliestEpochOrLowestSeries.description: he full name of the earliest possible geochronologic epoch or lowest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

latestEpochOrHighestSeries.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic epoch or highest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

earliestAgeOrLowestStage.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic age or lowest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

latestAgeOrHighestStage.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic age or highest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

lowestBiostratigraphicZone.description: The full name of the lowest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

highestBiostratigraphicZone.description: The full name of the highest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

lithostratigraphicTerms.description: The combination of all litho-stratigraphic names for the rock from which the cataloged item was collected.

group.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic group from which the cataloged item was collected.

formation.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic formation from which the cataloged item was collected.

member.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic member from which the cataloged item was collected.

bed.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic bed from which the cataloged item was collected.

identificationID.description:
An identifier for the Identification (the body of information associated with the assignment of a scientific name). 
May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

verbatimIdentification.description: A string representing the taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record.

identificationQualifier.description: A brief phrase or a standard term ("cf.", "aff.") to express the determiner's doubts about the Identification.

typeStatus.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.

identifiedBy.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the Taxon to the subject.

identifiedByID.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of the globally unique identifier for the person, people, groups, or organizations responsible for assigning the Taxon to the subject.

dateIdentified.description: The date on which the subject was determined as representing the Taxon.

identificationReferences.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the Identification.

identificationVerificationStatus.description: A categorical indicator of the extent to which the taxonomic identification has been verified to be correct.

identificationRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the Identification.

locationID.description: An identifier for the set of location information (data associated with dcterms:Location). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

higherGeographyID.description: An identifier for the geographic region within which the Location occurred.

higherGeography.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the locality term.

continent.description: The name of the continent in which the Location occurs.

waterBody.description: The name of the water body in which the Location occurs.

islandGroup.description: The name of the island on or near which the Location occurs.

country.description: The name of the country or major administrative unit in which the Location occurs.

countryCode.description: The standard code for the country in which the Location occurs.

stateProvince.description: The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the Location occurs.

county.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the Location occurs.

municipality.description:
The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than county (city, municipality, etc.) in which the Location occurs. 
Do not use this term for a nearby named place that does not contain the actual location.

locality.description: The specific description of the place.

verbatimLocality.description: The original textual description of the place.

minimumElevationInMeters.description: The lower limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

maximumElevationInMeters.description: The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

verbatimElevation.description: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.

verticalDatum.description: The vertical datum used as the reference upon which the values in the elevation terms are based.

minimumDepthInMeters.description: The lesser depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

maximumDepthInMeters.description: The greater depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

verbatimDepth.description: The original description of the depth below the local surface.

minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters.description:
The lesser distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. 
Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. 
If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.

maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters.description:
The greater distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. 
Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. 
If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.

locationAccordingTo.description: Information about the source of this Location information. Could be a publication (gazetteer), institution, or team of individuals.

locationRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the Location.

decimalLatitude.description:
The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. 
Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

decimalLongitude.description:
The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. 
Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

geodeticDatum.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude as based.

coordinateUncertaintyInMeters.description:
The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location. 
Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.

coordinatePrecision.description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude.

pointRadiusSpatialFit.description:
The ratio of the area of the point-radius (decimalLatitude, decimalLongitude, coordinateUncertaintyInMeters) to the area of the true (original, 
or most specific) spatial representation of the Location. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. 
A value of 0 should be used if the given point-radius does not completely contain the original representation. 
The pointRadiusSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left empty) if the original representation is a point without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same point (without uncertainty). 
If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the pointRadiusSpatialFit is 1.

verbatimCoordinates.description:
The verbatim original spatial coordinates of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) 
for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

verbatimLatitude.description:
The verbatim original latitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) 
for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

verbatimLongitude.description:
The verbatim original longitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) 
for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

verbatimCoordinateSystem.description: The coordinate format for the verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude or the verbatimCoordinates of the Location.

verbatimSRS.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which coordinates given in verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude, or verbatimCoordinates are based.

footprintWKT.description:
A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the shape (footprint, geometry) that defines the Location. 
A Location may have both a point-radius representation (see decimalLatitude) and a footprint representation, and they may differ from each other.

footprintSRS.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geometry given in footprintWKT is based.

footprintSpatialFit.description:
he ratio of the area of the footprint (footprintWKT) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of the Location. 
Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given footprint does not 
completely contain the original representation. The footprintSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left empty) if the original representation is a point without uncertainty 
and the given georeference is not that same point (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the footprintSpatialFit is 1.

georeferencedBy.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) for the Location.

georeferencedDate.description: The date on which the Location was georeferenced.

georeferenceProtocol.description: A description or reference to the methods used to determine the spatial footprint, coordinates, and uncertainties.

georeferenceSources.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.

georeferenceRemarks.description: Notes or comments about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in georeferenceProtocol.

materialSampleID.description:
An identifier for the MaterialSample (as opposed to a particular digital record of the material sample). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, 
construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the materialSampleID globally unique.

occurrenceID.description:
An identifier for the Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, 
construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the occurrenceID globally unique.

catalogNumber.description: An identifier (preferably unique) for the record within the data set or collection.

recordNumber.description: An identifier given to the Occurrence at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and an Occurrence record, such as a specimen collector's number.

recordedBy.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original Occurrence. 
The primary collector or observer, especially one who applies a personal identifier (recordNumber), should be listed first.

recordedByID.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of the globally unique identifier for the person, people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original Occurrence.

individualCount.description: The number of individuals present at the time of the Occurrence.

organismQuantity.description: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of organisms.

organismQuantityType.description: The type of quantification system used for the quantity of organisms.

sex.description: The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence.

lifeStage.description: The age class or life stage of the Organism(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded.

reproductiveCondition.description: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence.

behavior.description: The behavior shown by the subject at the time the Occurrence was recorded.

establishmentMeans.description: Statement about whether an organism or organisms have been introduced to a given place and time through the direct or indirect activity of modern humans.

degreeOfEstablishment.description: The degree to which an Organism survives, reproduces, and expands its range at the given place and time.

pathway.description: The process by which an Organism came to be in a given place at a given time.

georeferenceVerificationStatus.description: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial description for the Location of the Occurrence.

occurrenceStatus.description: A statement about the presence or absence of a Taxon at a Location.

preparations.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for a specimen.

disposition.description: The current state of a specimen with respect to the collection identified in collectionCode or collectionID.

associatedMedia.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of media associated with the Occurrence.

associatedOccurrences.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers of other Occurrence records and their associations to this Occurrence.

associatedReferences.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the Occurrence.

associatedSequences.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with the Occurrence.

associatedTaxa.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers or names of taxa and the associations of this Occurrence to each of them.

otherCatalogNumbers.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same Occurrence, 
whether in the current or any other data set or collection.

occurrenceRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the Occurrence.

organismID.description: An identifier for the Organism instance (as opposed to a particular digital record of the Organism). May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

organismName.description: A textual name or label assigned to an Organism instance.

organismScope.description: A description of the kind of Organism instance. Can be used to indicate whether the Organism instance represents a discrete organism or if it represents a particular type of aggregation.

associatedOrganisms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers of other Organisms and the associations of this Organism to each of them.

previousIdentifications.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous assignments of names to the Organism.

organismRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the Organism instance.

type.description: The nature or genre of the resource.

modified.description: The most recent date-time on which the resource was changed.

license.description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.

rightsHolder.description: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.

accessRights.description: Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status.

bibliographicCitation.description: A bibliographic reference for the resource as a statement indicating how this record should be cited (attributed) when used.

references.description: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource.

institutionID.description: An identifier for the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

collectionID.description: An identifier for the collection or dataset from which the record was derived.

datasetID.description: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution.

institutionCode.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

collectionCode.description: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived.

datasetName.description: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived.

ownerInstitutionCode.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having ownership of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

basisOfRecord.description: The specific nature of the data record.

informationWithheld.description: Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record.

dataGeneralizations.description: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.

dynamicProperties.description: A list of additional measurements, facts, characteristics, or assertions about the record. Meant to provide a mechanism for structured content.

taxonID.description: An identifier for the set of taxon information (data associated with the Taxon class). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

scientificNameID.description: An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic) details of a scientific name.

acceptedNameUsageID.description: An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) taxon.

parentNameUsageID.description:
An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) of the direct, 
most proximate higher-rank parent taxon (in a classification) of the most specific element of the scientificName.

originalNameUsageID.description:
An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) in which the terminal element of the scientificName 
was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

nameAccordingToID.description: An identifier for the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied.

namePublishedInID.description: An identifier for the publication in which the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

taxonConceptID.description: An identifier for the taxonomic concept to which the record refers - not for the nomenclatural details of a taxon.

scientificName.description:
The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of an Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. 
This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the IdentificationQualifier term.

acceptedNameUsage.description: The full name, with authorship and date information if known, of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) taxon.

parentNameUsage.description: The full name, with authorship and date information if known, of the direct, most proximate higher-rank parent taxon (in a classification) of the most specific element of the scientificName.

originalNameUsage.description:
The taxon name, with authorship and date information if known, as it originally appeared when first established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode. 
The basionym (botany) or basonym (bacteriology) of the scientificName or the senior/earlier homonym for replaced names.

nameAccordingTo.description:
The reference to the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied - traditionally signified by the Latin "sensu" or "sec." (from secundum, meaning "according to"). 
For taxa that result from identifications, a reference to the keys, monographs, experts and other sources should be given.

namePublishedIn.description: A reference for the publication in which the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

namePublishedInYear.description: The four-digit year in which the scientificName was published.

higherClassification.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa names terminating at the rank immediately superior to the taxon referenced in the taxon record.

kingdom.description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the taxon is classified.

phylum.description: The full scientific name of the phylum or division in which the taxon is classified.

class.description: The full scientific name of the class in which the taxon is classified.

order.description: The full scientific name of the order in which the taxon is classified.

family.description: The full scientific name of the family in which the taxon is classified.

subfamily.description: The full scientific name of the subfamily in which the taxon is classified.

genus.description: The full scientific name of the genus in which the taxon is classified.

genericName.description: The genus part of the scientificName without authorship.

subgenus.description: The full scientific name of the subgenus in which the taxon is classified. Values should include the genus to avoid homonym confusion.

infragenericEpithet.description: The infrageneric part of a binomial name at ranks above species but below genus.

specificEpithet.description: The name of the first or species epithet of the scientificName.

infraspecificEpithet.description: The name of the lowest or terminal infraspecific epithet of the scientificName, excluding any rank designation.

cultivarEpithet.description: Part of the name of a cultivar, cultivar group or grex that follows the scientific name.

taxonRank.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName.

verbatimTaxonRank.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName as it appears in the original record.

scientificNameAuthorship.description: The authorship information for the scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable nomenclaturalCode.

nomenclaturalCode.description: The nomenclatural code (or codes in the case of an ambiregnal name) under which the scientificName is constructed.

taxonomicStatus.description:
The status of the use of the scientificName as a label for a taxon. Requires taxonomic opinion to define the scope of a taxon. 
Rules of priority then are used to define the taxonomic status of the nomenclature contained in that scope, combined with the experts opinion. 
It must be linked to a specific taxonomic reference that defines the concept.

nomenclaturalStatus.description:
The status related to the original publication of the name and its conformance to the relevant rules of nomenclature. 
It is based essentially on an algorithm according to the business rules of the code. It requires no taxonomic opinion.

taxonRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the taxon or name.

DarwinCoreOccurrenceDto.description: The category of information pertaining to the existence of an Organism (sensu http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/Organism) at a particular place at a particular time.

identifier.description: A unique text identifer for the data provider.

name.description: The name of the data provider.

path.description: Paths that can be used to group and visualize a data provider as a tree in a GUI.

url.description: URL to the data provider source.

latestIncrementalHarvestDate.description: Latest incremental harvest and process date. Used for data providers supporting incremental harvest.

nextHarvestFrom.description: Date time from where next harvest can be run.

harvestSchedule.description: Cron expression used to schedule harvest.

includeInSearchByDefault.description: Decides whether the data provider should be included in search when no data provider filter is set.

uniqueKey.description: Hashed key created from observation date + taxon id + position

startDate.description: Observation start date specified in the ISO 8601 standard. If no timezone is specified, GMT+1 (CEST) is assumed

endDate.description: Observation end date specified in the ISO 8601 standard. If no timezone is specified, GMT+1 (CEST) is assumed

DateFilterTypeDto.description:
OverlappingStartDateAndEndDate, Start or EndDate of the observation must be within the specified interval    
BetweenStartDateAndEndDate, Start and EndDate of the observation must be within the specified interval    
OnlyStartDate, Only StartDate of the observation must be within the specified interval            
OnlyEndDate, Only EndDate of the observation must be within the specified interval

environmentType.description: Type of environment (Local, Dev, ST, AT, Prod)

hostingServerName.description: Name of the server hosting the application/service

eventId.description: An identifier for the set of information associated with an Event (something that occurs at a place and time).

startDate.description: Start date/time of the event in W. Europe Standard Time.

startYear.description: Start year of the event, Swedish localization

startMonth.description: Start month of the event, Swedish localization

startDay.description: Start day of the event, Swedish localization

endDate.description: End date/time of the event in W. Europe Standard Time.

endYear.description: End year of the event, Swedish localization

endMonth.description: End month of the event, Swedish localization

endDay.description: End day of the event, Swedish localization

plainStartDate.description: Start date of the event in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

plainEndDate.description: End date of the event in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

plainStartTime.description: Start time of the event in W. Europe Standard Time formatted as hh:mm.

plainEndTime.description: End time of the event in W. Europe Standard Time formatted as hh:mm.

eventRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the Event.

fieldNotes.description:
One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a
reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of
notes taken in the field about the Event.

fieldNumber.description:
An identifier given to the event in the field. Often
serves as a link between field notes and the Event.

habitat.description: A category or description of the habitat in which the Event occurred.

measurementOrFacts.description: Measurement or facts associated with the event.

parentEventId.description: An identifier for the broader Event that groups this and potentially other Events.
parentEventId.example: A1 (parentEventID to identify the main Whittaker Plot in nested samples, each with its own eventID - A1:1, A1:2).

samplingEffort.description: The amount of effort expended during an Event.

samplingProtocol.description:
The name of, reference to, or description of the
method or protocol used during an Event.

sampleSizeUnit.description:
The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.
A sampleSizeUnit must have a corresponding sampleSizeValue, e.g., 5 for sampleSizeValue with metre for
sampleSizeUnit.
sampleSizeUnit.example: minute, hour, day, metre, square metre, cubic metre.

sampleSizeValue.description:
A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling
event.
sampleSizeValue.example: 5 for sampleSizeValue with metre for sampleSizeUnit.

verbatimEventDate.description:
The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for an Event.
Examples: spring 1910, Marzo 2002, 1999-03-XX, 17IV1934.

Event.description: Event information about a species observation.

occurrenceIds.description: Exclude observations with listed occurrence id's

reportedByUserServiceUserId.description: Reported by user service user id.

observedByUserServiceUserId.description: Observed by user service user id.

hasInvasiveSpeciesTreatment.description:
If true, only records with InvasiveSpeciesTreatment are included.
If false, only records with no InvasiveSpeciesTreatment are included.
If null, no filtering is applied.

invasiveSpeciesTreatmentIds.description:
Ids of InvasiveSpeciesTreatment to match. 
If null or empty, no filtering is done.
Queryable values are available in InvasiveSpeciesTreatment vocabulary.

onlyWithMedia.description: Only include hits with media associated

onlyWithNotes.description: Only include hits with notes attached to them

onlyWithUserComments.description: Only include hits that have user comments on them

measurementID.description:
An identifier for the MeasurementOrFact (information pertaining
to measurements, facts, characteristics, or assertions).
May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

occurrenceID.description:
The identifier of the occurrence the measurement or fact refers to.
If not applicable, it should be left empty.

measurementType.description:
The nature of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.
Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

measurementTypeID.description:
An identifier for the measurementType (global unique identifier, URI).
The identifier should reference the measurementType in a vocabulary.

measurementValue.description: The value of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

measurementValueID.description:
An identifier for facts stored in the column measurementValue (global unique identifier, URI).
This identifier can reference a controlled vocabulary (e.g. for sampling instrument names,
methodologies, life stages) or reference a methodology paper with a DOI. When the measurementValue
refers to a value and not to a fact, the measurementvalueID has no meaning and should remain empty.

measurementAccuracy.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

measurementUnit.description:
The units associated with the measurementValue.
Recommended best practice is to use the International System of Units (SI).

measurementUnitID.description:
An identifier for the measurementUnit (global unique identifier, URI).
The identifier should reference the measurementUnit in a vocabulary.

measurementDeterminedDate.description:
The date on which the MeasurementOrFact was made. Recommended best
practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

measurementDeterminedBy.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations
who determined the value of the MeasurementOrFact.

measurementMethod.description:
A description of or reference to (publication, URI) the method or protocol used
to determine the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

measurementRemarks.description: Comments or notes accompanying the MeasurementOrFact.

ExtendedMeasurementOrFact.description: Measurement or facts for an observation or event.

key.description: The key in the external system.

created.description: Date time when file was created

considerDisturbanceRadius.description:
If true, observations that are outside Geometries polygons
but close enough when disturbance sensitivity of species
are considered, will be included in the result.

considerObservationAccuracy.description:
If true, observations that are outside Geometries polygons
but possibly inside when accuracy (coordinateUncertaintyInMeters)
of observation is considered, will be included in the result.

considerAuthorizationBuffer.description: If true, use the buffer (if any) that can be applied to extend the area where the user has permission to search for sensitive observations

maxDistanceFromPoint.description:
If Geometries is of point type, this property must be set to a value greater than 0.
Observations inside circle (center=point, radius=MaxDistanceFromPoint) will be returned.

geometries.description:
Point or polygon geometry used for search.
If the geometry is a point, then MaxDistanceFromPoint is also used in search.

locationIds.description: Filter on location id/s. Only observations with passed location id/s this will be returned

maxAccuracy.description: Limit observation accuracy. Only observations with accuracy less than this will be returned

bed.description:
The full name of the lithostratigraphic bed from which
the cataloged item was collected.

earliestAgeOrLowestStage.description:
The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic
age or lowest chronostratigraphic stage attributable
to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged
item was collected.

earliestEonOrLowestEonothem.description:
The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic eon
or lowest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal
name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic
horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

earliestEpochOrLowestSeries.description:
The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic
epoch or lowest chronostratigraphic series attributable
to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged
item was collected.

earliestEraOrLowestErathem.description:
The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic
era or lowest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable
to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged
item was collected.

earliestGeochronologicalEra.description:
Use to link a dwc:GeologicalContext instance to chronostratigraphic time
periods at the lowest possible level in a standardized hierarchy. Use this
property to point to the earliest possible geological time period from which
the cataloged item was collected.

earliestPeriodOrLowestSystem.description:
The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic
period or lowest chronostratigraphic system attributable
to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged
item was collected.

formation.description:
The full name of the lithostratigraphic formation from
which the cataloged item was collected.

geologicalContextId.description:
An identifier for the set of information associated
with a GeologicalContext (the location within a geological
context, such as stratigraphy). May be a global unique
identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

group.description:
The full name of the lithostratigraphic group from
which the cataloged item was collected.

highestBiostratigraphicZone.description:
The full name of the highest possible geological
biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon
from which the cataloged item was collected.

latestAgeOrHighestStage.description:
The full name of the latest possible geochronologic
age or highest chronostratigraphic stage attributable
to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged
item was collected.

latestEonOrHighestEonothem.description:
The full name of the latest possible geochronologic eon
or highest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal
name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic
horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

latestEpochOrHighestSeries.description:
The full name of the latest possible geochronologic
epoch or highest chronostratigraphic series attributable
to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged
item was collected.

latestEraOrHighestErathem.description:
The full name of the latest possible geochronologic
era or highest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable
to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged
item was collected.

latestGeochronologicalEra.description:
Use to link a dwc:GeologicalContext instance to chronostratigraphic time periods at the lowest possible
level in a standardized hierarchy. Use this property to point to the latest possible geological time period
from which the cataloged item was collected.

latestPeriodOrHighestSystem.description:
The full name of the latest possible geochronologic
period or highest chronostratigraphic system attributable
to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged
item was collected.

lithostratigraphicTerms.description:
The combination of all litho-stratigraphic names for
the rock from which the cataloged item was collected.

lowestBiostratigraphicZone.description:
The full name of the lowest possible geological
biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon
from which the cataloged item was collected.

member.description:
The full name of the lithostratigraphic member from
which the cataloged item was collected.

GeologicalContext.description: Geological information, such as stratigraphy, that qualifies a region or place.

dateIdentified.description:
The date on which the subject was identified as
representing the Taxon. Recommended best practice is
to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

identificationId.description:
An identifier for the Identification (the body of
information associated with the assignment of a scientific
name). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier
specific to the data set.

identificationQualifier.description:
A brief phrase or a standard term ("cf.", "aff.") to
express the determiner's doubts about the Identification.

identificationReferences.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of references
(publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in
the Identification.

identificationRemarks.description:
Comments or notes about the Identification.
Contains for example information about that
the observer is uncertain about which species
that has been observed.

validated.description:
True if sighting is validated.
This property is deprecated and replaced by the Verified property.

identifiedBy.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people,
groups, or organizations who assigned the Taxon to the
subject.

typeStatus.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural
types (type status, typified scientific name, publication)
applied to the subject.

verifiedBy.description:
A list(concatenated and separated) of names of people,
who verified the observation.

Identification.description: Identification information about an species observation.

coordinatePrecision.description:
A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates
given in the DecimalLatitude and DecimalLongitude.

coordinateUncertaintyInMeters.description:
The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given
CoordinateX and CoordinateY describing the
smallest circle containing the whole of the Location.
Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot
be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are
no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.

countryCode.description:
The standard code for the country in which the
Location occurs.
Recommended best practice is to use ISO 3166-1-alpha-2
country codes.

decimalLatitude.description:
The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using
the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum)
of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values
are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it.
Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

decimalLongitude.description:
The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using
the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum)
of the geographic center of a Location. Positive
values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative
values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180
and 180, inclusive.

footprintSpatialFit.description:
The ratio of the area of the footprint (footprintWKT)
to the area of the true (original, or most specific)
spatial representation of the Location. Legal values are
0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of
1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should
be used if the given footprint does not completely contain
the original representation. The footprintSpatialFit is
undefined (and should be left blank) if the original
representation is a point and the given georeference is
not that same point. If both the original and the given
georeference are the same point, the footprintSpatialFit
is 1.

footprintSRS.description:
A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the Spatial
Reference System (SRS) for the footprintWKT of the
Location. Do not use this term to describe the SRS of
the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude, even if it is
the same as for the footprintWKT - use the geodeticDatum
instead.

footprintWKT.description:
A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the shape
(footprint, geometry) that defines the Location.
A Location may have both a point-radius representation
(see decimalLatitude) and a footprint representation,
and they may differ from each other.

geodeticDatum.description:
The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference
system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates
given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude as based.
Recommended best practice is use the EPSG code as a
controlled vocabulary to provide an SRS, if known.
Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or
code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a
controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the
ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the
value "unknown".

georeferencedBy.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people,
groups, or organizations who determined the georeference
(spatial representation) the Location.

georeferencedDate.description:
The date on which the Location was georeferenced.
Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme,
such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

georeferenceProtocol.description:
A description or reference to the methods used to
determine the spatial footprint, coordinates, and
uncertainties.

georeferenceRemarks.description:
Notes or comments about the spatial description
determination, explaining assumptions made in addition
or opposition to the those formalized in the method
referred to in georeferenceProtocol.

georeferenceSources.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers,
or other resources used to georeference the Location,
described specifically enough to allow anyone in the
future to use the same resources.

georeferenceVerificationStatus.description:
A categorical description of the extent to which the
georeference has been verified to represent the best
possible spatial description. Recommended best practice
is to use a controlled vocabulary.

higherGeography.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic
names less specific than the information captured
in the locality term.

higherGeographyId.description:
An identifier for the geographic region within which
the Location occurred.
Recommended best practice is to use an
persistent identifier from a controlled vocabulary
such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

island.description:
The name of the island on or near which the Location occurs.
Recommended best practice is to use a controlled
vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

islandGroup.description:
The name of the island group in which the Location occurs.
Recommended best practice is to use a controlled
vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

locality.description:
The specific description of the place. Less specific
geographic information can be provided in other
geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country,
stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island,
islandGroup). This term may contain information modified
from the original to correct perceived errors or
standardize the description.

locationAccordingTo.description:
Information about the source of this Location information.
Could be a publication (gazetteer), institution,
or team of individuals.

locationId.description:
An identifier for the set of location information
(data associated with dcterms:Location).
May be a global unique identifier or an identifier
specific to the data set.

locationRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the Location.

maximumDepthInMeters.description:
The greater depth of a range of depth below
the local surface, in meters.

maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters.description:
The greater distance in a range of distance from a
reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters.
Use positive values for locations above the surface,
negative values for locations below. If depth measures
are given, the reference surface is the location given
by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the
location given by the elevation.

maximumElevationInMeters.description:
The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude,
usually above sea level), in meters.

minimumDepthInMeters.description:
The lesser depth of a range of depth below the
local surface, in meters.

minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters.description:
The lesser distance in a range of distance from a
reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters.
Use positive values for locations above the surface,
negative values for locations below.
If depth measures are given, the reference surface is
the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference
surface is the location given by the elevation.

minimumElevationInMeters.description:
The lower limit of the range of elevation (altitude,
usually above sea level), in meters.

pointRadiusSpatialFit.description:
The ratio of the area of the point-radius
(decimalLatitude, decimalLongitude,
coordinateUncertaintyInMeters) to the area of the true
(original, or most specific) spatial representation of
the Location. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal
to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or
100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given
point-radius does not completely contain the original
representation. The pointRadiusSpatialFit is undefined
(and should be left blank) if the original representation
is a point without uncertainty and the given georeference
is not that same point (without uncertainty). If both the
original and the given georeference are the same point,
the pointRadiusSpatialFit is 1.

verbatimCoordinates.description:
The verbatim original spatial coordinates of the Location.
The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full
Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates
should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate
system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

verbatimCoordinateSystem.description:
The spatial coordinate system for the verbatimLatitude
and verbatimLongitude or the verbatimCoordinates of the
Location.
Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

verbatimDepth.description:
The original description of the
depth below the local surface.

verbatimElevation.description:
The original description of the elevation (altitude,
usually above sea level) of the Location.

verbatimLatitude.description:
The verbatim original latitude of the Location.
The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full
Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates
should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate
system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

verbatimLocality.description: The original textual description of the place.

verbatimLongitude.description:
The verbatim original longitude of the Location.
The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full
Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates
should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate
system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

verbatimSRS.description:
The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference
system (SRS) upon which coordinates given in
verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude, or
verbatimCoordinates are based.
Recommended best practice is use the EPSG code as
a controlled vocabulary to provide an SRS, if known.
Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or
code of the geodetic datum, if known.
Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or
code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is
known, use the value "unknown".

waterBody.description:
The name of the water body in which the Location occurs.
Recommended best practice is to use a controlled
vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

Location.description: Location information for a species observation.

verbatimMunicipality.description: The original municipality value from data provider.

verbatimProvince.description: The original StateProvince value from data provider.

coordinatePrecision.description:
A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates
given in the DecimalLatitude and DecimalLongitude.

coordinateUncertaintyInMeters.description:
The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given
CoordinateX and CoordinateY describing the
smallest circle containing the whole of the Location.
Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot
be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are
no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.

countryCode.description:
The standard code for the country in which the
Location occurs.
Recommended best practice is to use ISO 3166-1-alpha-2
country codes.

decimalLatitude.description:
The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using
the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum)
of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values
are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it.
Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

decimalLongitude.description:
The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using
the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum)
of the geographic center of a Location. Positive
values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative
values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180
and 180, inclusive.

locality.description:
The specific description of the place. Less specific
geographic information can be provided in other
geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country,
stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island,
islandGroup). This term may contain information modified
from the original to correct perceived errors or
standardize the description.

locationAccordingTo.description:
Information about the source of this Location information.
Could be a publication (gazetteer), institution,
or team of individuals.

locationId.description:
An identifier for the set of location information
(data associated with dcterms:Location).
May be a global unique identifier or an identifier
specific to the data set.

locationRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the Location.

materialSampleId.description:
An identifier for the MaterialSample (as opposed to a particular digital record of the material sample).
In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the
record
that will most closely make the materialSampleID globally unique.

MaterialSample.description:
A physical result of a sampling (or subsampling) event. In biological collections, the material sample is typically
collected,
and either preserved or destructively processed.

skip.description:
Ignores the specified number of items and returns a sequence starting at the item after the last skipped item (if
any)

take.description: Returns a sequence containing up to the specified number of items. Anything after the count is ignored

totalCount.description: Total number of records matching the query

isGeneralized.description: Indicates whether the location is generalized.

hasGeneralizedObservationInOtherIndex.description: Indicates whether there exists a generalized location in other index.

bibliographicCitation.description:
A bibliographic reference for the resource as a statement
indicating how this record should be cited (attributed)
when used.
Recommended practice is to include sufficient
bibliographic detail to identify the resource as
unambiguously as possible.

collectionCode.description:
The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying the
collection or data set from which the record was derived.

collectionId.description:
An identifier for the collection or dataset from which
the record was derived.
For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is
to use the identifier in a collections registry such as
the Biodiversity Collections Index
(http://www.biodiversitycollectionsindex.org/).

dataGeneralizations.description:
Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or
complete than in its original form.
Suggests that alternative data of higher quality
may be available on request.

datasetId.description:
An identifier for the set of data.
May be a global unique identifier or an identifier
specific to a collection or institution.

datasetName.description:
The name identifying the data set
from which the record was derived.

dynamicProperties.description:
A list of additional measurements, facts, characteristics, or assertions about the record.
Meant to provide a mechanism for structured content.
Recommended best practice is to use a key:value encoding schema for a data interchange format such as JSON.

informationWithheld.description:
Additional information that exists, but that has
not been shared in the given record.

institutionId.description: An identifier for the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

language.description:
A language of the resource.
Recommended best practice is to use a controlled
vocabulary such as RFC 4646 [RFC4646].

license.description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.

modified.description:
The most recent date-time on which the resource was changed (UTC).
For Darwin Core, recommended best practice is to use an
encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

ownerInstitutionCode.description:
The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having
ownership of the object(s) or information referred
to in the record.

protected.description:
Indicates whether the observation is protected.
This property is deprecated and replaced by the Sensitive property.

sensitive.description: Indicates whether the observation is sensitive and therefore protected.

references.description:
A related resource that is referenced, cited,
or otherwise pointed to by the described resource.

rightsHolder.description:
A person or organization owning or
managing rights over the resource.

measurementOrFacts.description: Measurement or facts associated with the observation.

projects.description: Projects from Artportalen associated with the observation.

created.description: The date the observation was created (UTC).

skip.description:
Ignores the specified number of items and returns a sequence starting at the item after the last skipped item (if
any)

take.description: Returns a sequence containing up to the specified number of items. Anything after the count is ignored

totalCount.description: Total number of records matching the query

ObservationGeoPagedResultDto.description: Result returned by paged query. Can contain GeoJSON if requested.

skip.description:
Ignores the specified number of items and returns a sequence starting at the item after the last skipped item (if
any)

take.description: Returns a sequence containing up to the specified number of items. Anything after the count is ignored

totalCount.description: Total number of records matching the query

hasMorePages.description: True if more pages can be retrieved using the ScrollId; otherwise false.

scrollId.description: The scroll id used for retrieving next page of records.

take.description: Returns a sequence containing up to the specified number of items.

totalCount.description: Total number of records matching the query

nextCursor.description:
The cursor value for the next page.
Pass this value in the next request to get the next page of results.
Will be null when there are no more results.
This value is base64-encoded string representation of the sort values.

take.description: Returns a sequence containing up to the specified number of items.

totalCount.description: Total number of records matching the query.

records.description: The records for the current page.

ObservationSearchByCursorResultDto.description:
Result returned by search_after query for deep pagination.
This enables pagination beyond the 10,000 document limit of standard Elasticsearch pagination.

associatedMedia.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers
(publication, global unique identifier, URI) of
media associated with the Occurrence.

associatedOccurrences.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers of
other Occurrence records and their associations to
this Occurrence.

associatedReferences.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers
(publication, bibliographic reference, global unique
identifier, URI) of literature associated with
the Occurrence.

associatedSequences.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) 
of genetic sequence information associated with the Occurrence.

associatedTaxa.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers or
names of taxa and their associations with the Occurrence.

catalogNumber.description:
An identifier (preferably unique) for the record
within the data set or collection.

catalogId.description: An int32 identifier (preferably unique) for the record within the data set or collection.

disposition.description:
The current state of a specimen with respect to the
collection identified in collectionCode or collectionID.
Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

individualCount.description:
The number of individuals represented present
at the time of the Occurrence.

isNaturalOccurrence.description:
Indicates if this species occurrence is natural or
if it is a result of human activity.

isNeverFoundObservation.description:
Indicates if this observation is a never found observation.
"Never found observation" is an observation that says
that the specified species was not found in a location
deemed appropriate for the species.

isNotRediscoveredObservation.description:
Indicates if this observation is a
not rediscovered observation.
"Not rediscovered observation" is an observation that says
that the specified species was not found in a location
where it has previously been observed.

isPositiveObservation.description:
Indicates if this observation is a positive observation.
"Positive observation" is a normal observation indicating
that a species has been seen at a specified location.

occurrenceId.description:
An identifier for the Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the occurrence).
In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of
identifiers in the record that will most closely make the occurrenceID globally unique.

occurrenceRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the Occurrence.

otherCatalogNumbers.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or
alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other
human-used identifiers for the same Occurrence,
whether in the current or any other data set or collection.

organismQuantity.description:
A number or enumeration value for the quantity of organisms.
A dwc:organismQuantity must have a corresponding dwc:organismQuantityType.
organismQuantity.example:
27 (organismQuantity) with individuals (organismQuantityType).
                12.5 (organismQuantity) with %biomass (organismQuantityType).
                r (organismQuantity) with BraunBlanquetScale (organismQuantityType).

organismQuantityInt.description: The quantity of organisms as integer. This field is necessary because we want to be able to do range-querys against quantities.

preparations.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations
and preservation methods for a specimen.

sensitivityCategory.description:
Information about how protected information about a species is in Sweden.
This is a value between 1 to 5.
1 indicates public access and 5 is the highest used security level.

recordedBy.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people,
groups, or organizations responsible for recording the
original Occurrence. The primary collector or observer,
especially one who applies a personal identifier
(recordNumber), should be listed first.

recordNumber.description:
An identifier given to the Occurrence at the time it was
recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and
an Occurrence record, such as a specimen collector's number.

reportedBy.description: Name of the person that reported the species observation.

reportedDate.description: Date and time when the species observation was reported (UTC).

Occurrence.description: Occurrence information about a species observation.

OccurrenceStatusFilterValuesDto.description: Possible values for the OccurrenceStatus filter.

organismId.description:
An identifier for the Organism instance (as opposed to a particular digital record of the Organism).
May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

organismName.description: A textual name or label assigned to an Organism instance.

organismScope.description:
A description of the kind of Organism instance. Can be used to indicate whether
the Organism instance represents a discrete organism or if it represents
a particular type of aggregation..

associatedOrganisms.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers of other Organisms and their
associations to this Organism.

previousIdentifications.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous assignments of names to the Organism.

organismRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the Organism instance..

Organism.description: A particular organism or defined group of organisms considered to be taxonomically homogeneous.

fields.description:
This parameter allows you to decide what fields should be returned, using a projection.
Omit this parameter and you will receive the complete collection of fields.
For example, to retrieve only basic observation data, specify:
["event.startDate", "event.endDate", "location.decimalLatitude", "location.decimalLongitude", "location.municipality", "taxon.id", "taxon.scientificName", "occurrence.recordedBy", "occurrence.occurrenceStatus"].

This parameter allows you to decide what fields should be returned, using a projection.
Omit this parameter and you will receive the complete collection of fields.
For example, to retrieve only basic observation data, specify:
["event.startDate", "event.endDate", "location.decimalLatitude", "location.decimalLongitude", "location.municipality", "taxon.id", "taxon.scientificName", "occurrence.recordedBy", "occurrence.occurrenceStatus"].

Precipitation.description: States the precipitation conditions during the survey event.

isHidden.description: Only available to owner and members

isPublic.description:
Indicates if species observations that are reported in
a project are publicly available or not.

category.description:
Information about the type of project,
for example 'Environmental monitoring'.

categorySwedish.description:
Information about the type of project in Swedish,
for example 'Miljöövervakning'.

controlingOrganisationId.description: Id of controling organization if any

controlingUserId.description: Id of controling user if any

owner.description: Name of person or organization that owns the project.

projectURL.description:
Web address that leads to more information about the
project. The information should be accessible
from the most commonly used web browsers.

surveyMethod.description:
Survey method used in a project to
retrieve species observations.

isPublic.description:
Indicates if species observations that are reported in
a project are publicly available or not.

category.description:
Information about the type of project,
for example 'Environmental monitoring'.

categorySwedish.description:
Information about the type of project in Swedish,
for example 'Miljöövervakning'.

owner.description: Name of person or organization that owns the project.

projectURL.description: Web address that leads to more information about the project.

surveyMethod.description:
Survey method used in a project to
retrieve species observations.

ProjectDto.description: Information about a project in Artportalen.

unit.description: Unit for this species observation project parameter..

value.description: Value of the data in string format.

dataTypeNullable.description: Indicates whether the data type is nullable.

partOfFieldSets.description: The field sets this property is part of.

birdNestActivityLimit.description:
Limit returned observations based on bird nest activity level.
Only bird observations in Artportalen are affected
by this search criteria.
Observation of other organism groups (not birds) are
not affected by this search criteria.

observedByMe.description: Only get observations observed by me

reportedByMe.description: Only get observations reported by me

Observation of other organism groups (not birds) are
not affected by this search criteria.

includeRealCount.description: By default totalCount in search response will not exceed 10 000. If IncludeRealCount is true, totalCount will show the real number of hits. Even if it's more than 10 000 (performance cost)
