Limit returned observations based on bird nest activity level.
Only bird observations in Artportalen are affected
by this search criteria.
Observation of other organism groups (not birds) are
not affected by this search criteria.

startDate.description: Observation start date specified in the ISO 8601 standard. If no timezone is specified, GMT+1 (CEST) is assumed

sortBy.description: Name of field to sort by

acceptedNameUsage.description:
The full name, with authorship and date information
if known, of the currently valid (zoological) or
accepted (botanical) taxon.

acceptedNameUsageId.description:
An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of
the name according to a source) of the currently valid
(zoological) or accepted (botanical) taxon.

class.description:
The full scientific name of the class in which
the taxon is classified.

family.description:
The full scientific name of the family in which
the taxon is classified.

genus.description:
The full scientific name of the genus in which
the taxon is classified.

higherClassification.description:
A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa names
terminating at the rank immediately superior to the
taxon referenced in the taxon record.
Recommended best practice is to order the list
starting with the highest rank and separating the names
for each rank with a semi-colon (";").

infraspecificEpithet.description:
The name of the lowest or terminal infraspecific epithet
of the scientificName, excluding any rank designation.

kingdom.description:
The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the
taxon is classified.

nameAccordingTo.description:
The reference to the source in which the specific
taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied -
traditionally signified by the Latin "sensu" or "sec."
(from secundum, meaning "according to").
For taxa that result from identifications, a reference
to the keys, monographs, experts and other sources should
be given.

nameAccordingToId.description:
An identifier for the source in which the specific
taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied.
See nameAccordingTo.

namePublishedIn.description:
A reference for the publication in which the
scientificName was originally established under the rules
of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

namePublishedInId.description:
An identifier for the publication in which the
scientificName was originally established under the
rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

namePublishedInYear.description:
The four-digit year in which the scientificName
was published.

nomenclaturalCode.description:
The nomenclatural code (or codes in the case of an
ambiregnal name) under which the scientificName is
constructed.
Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

nomenclaturalStatus.description:
The status related to the original publication of the
name and its conformance to the relevant rules of
nomenclature. It is based essentially on an algorithm
according to the business rules of the code.
It requires no taxonomic opinion.

order.description:
The full scientific name of the order in which
the taxon is classified.

originalNameUsage.description:
The taxon name, with authorship and date information
if known, as it originally appeared when first established
under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.
The basionym (botany) or basonym (bacteriology) of the
scientificName or the senior/earlier homonym for replaced
names.

originalNameUsageId.description:
An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of
the name according to a source) in which the terminal
element of the scientificName was originally established
under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

parentNameUsage.description:
The full name, with authorship and date information
if known, of the direct, most proximate higher-rank
parent taxon (in a classification) of the most specific
element of the scientificName.

parentNameUsageId.description:
An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning
of the name according to a source) of the direct,
most proximate higher-rank parent taxon
(in a classification) of the most specific
element of the scientificName.

phylum.description:
The full scientific name of the phylum or division
in which the taxon is classified.

scientificName.description:
The full scientific name, with authorship and date
information if known. When forming part of an
Identification, this should be the name in lowest level
taxonomic rank that can be determined.
This term should not contain identification qualifications,
which should instead be supplied in the
IdentificationQualifier term.
Currently scientific name without author is provided.

scientificNameAuthorship.description:
The authorship information for the scientificName
formatted according to the conventions of the applicable
nomenclaturalCode.

scientificNameId.description:
An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic)
details of a scientific name.

specificEpithet.description:
The name of the first or species epithet of
the scientificName.

subgenus.description:
The full scientific name of the subgenus in which
the taxon is classified. Values should include the
genus to avoid homonym confusion.

taxonConceptId.description:
An identifier for the taxonomic concept to which the record
refers - not for the nomenclatural details of a taxon.
In SwedishSpeciesObservationSOAPService this property
has the same value as property TaxonID.
GUID in Dyntaxa is used as value for this property.

taxonId.description:
An identifier for the set of taxon information
(data associated with the Taxon class). May be a global
unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.
In SwedishSpeciesObservationSOAPService this property
has the same value as property TaxonConceptID.
GUID in Dyntaxa is used as value for this property.

taxonomicStatus.description:
The status of the use of the scientificName as a label
for a taxon. Requires taxonomic opinion to define the
scope of a taxon. Rules of priority then are used to
define the taxonomic status of the nomenclature contained
in that scope, combined with the experts opinion.
It must be linked to a specific taxonomic reference that
defines the concept.
Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

taxonRank.description:
The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the
scientificName. Recommended best practice is to use
a controlled vocabulary.

taxonRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the taxon or name.

verbatimTaxonRank.description:
The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the
scientificName as it appears in the original record.

Taxon.description: This class contains taxon information about a species observation.

skip.description:
Ignores the specified number of items and returns a sequence starting at the item after the last skipped item (if
any)

take.description: Returns a sequence containing up to the specified number of items. Anything after the count is ignored

totalCount.description: Total number of records matching the query

actionPlan.description:
Indicates whether the species is the subject
of an action plan ('åtgärdsprogram' in swedish).

isInvasiveAccordingToEuRegulation.description: True if invasive in sweden according to EU Regulation 1143/2014.

isRedlisted.description: True if derived redlist category is one of CR, EN, VU, NT.

organismGroup.description:
Common name of the organism group that observed species
belongs to. Classification of species groups is the same as
used in latest 'Red List of Swedish Species'.

protectedByLaw.description:
Indicates whether the species 
is protected by the law in Sweden.

redlistCategory.description:
Redlist category for redlisted species. Possible redlist values
are DD (Data Deficient), EX (Extinct),
RE (Regionally Extinct), CR (Critically Endangered),
EN (Endangered), VU (Vulnerable), NT (Near Threatened).
Not redlisted species has no value in this property.

redlistCategoryDerived.description: Derivied red list category from parent taxa

swedishOccurrence.description:
Information about the species occurrence in Sweden.
For example information about if the species reproduce
in sweden.

swedishHistory.description:
This property contains information about the species
immigration history.

includeUnderlyingTaxa.description:
If true, also include the underlying hierarchical taxa in search.
E.g. If ids=[4000104](Aves) and includeUnderlyingTaxa=true, then you search for all birds.

isInvasiveInSweden.description:
Search for only invasive taxa (true)
Search for non invasive taxa (false)
Search for both (null)

taxonListIds.description: Add (merge) or filter taxa by using taxon lists.

includeUnderlyingTaxa.description:
If true, also include the underlying hierarchical taxa in search.
E.g. If ids=[4000104](Aves) and includeUnderlyingTaxa=true, then you search for all birds.

isInvasiveInSweden.description:
Search for only invasive taxa (true)
Search for non invasive taxa (false)
Search for both (null)

taxonListIds.description: Add (merge) or filter taxa by using taxon lists.

redListCategories.description:
Redlist categories to match.
Possible values are: "DD", "EX", "RE", "CR", "EN", "VU", "NT", "LC", "NA", "NE"

canBeUsedInSignalSearch.description: Is the list allowed in signal search?

id.description: The Id of the taxon list.

parentId.description: The parent Id of the taxon list.

name.description: The name of the taxon list.

TaxonListOperatorDto.description: Operator to use when TaxonListIds is specified.

isPreferredName.description:
This term is true if the source citing the use of this scientific name indicates the usage has 
some preference or specific standing over other possible scientific names used for the species.

sumObservationCount.description: Sum of observation count including underlying taxa observation count.

provinceCount.description: Number of provinces the taxon is observed.

sumProvinceCount.description: Number of provinces the taxon is observed including underlying taxa.

sumObservationCountByProvinceId.description: Sum of observation count including underlying taxa observation count, by Province id.

TaxonSumAggregationItem.description: Taxon aggregation item containing sum of underlying taxa values.

skip.description:
Ignores the specified number of items and returns a sequence starting at the item after the last skipped item (if
any)

take.description: Returns a sequence containing up to the specified number of items. Anything after the count is ignored

totalCount.description: Total number of records matching the query

taxonomicStatus.description:
The status of the use of the scientificName as a label
for a taxon. Requires taxonomic opinion to define the
scope of a taxon. Rules of priority then are used to
define the taxonomic status of the nomenclature contained
in that scope, combined with the experts opinion.
It must be linked to a specific taxonomic reference that
defines the concept.
Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

nomenclaturalStatus.description:
The status related to the original publication of the
name and its conformance to the relevant rules of
nomenclature. It is based essentially on an algorithm
according to the business rules of the code.
It requires no taxonomic opinion.

language.description: ISO 639-1 language code used for the vernacular name value..

countryCode.description:
The standard code for the country in which the vernacular name is used.
Recommended best practice is to use the ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 country codes available as a vocabulary
at http://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/iso/3166-1_alpha2.xml. For multiple countries separate values with a comma ","

isPreferredName.description:
This term is true if the source citing the use of this vernacular name indicates the usage has 
some preference or specific standing over other possible vernacular names used for the species.

Unit.description:
Unit for a certain amount of organisms (given in the attribute quantity) or
Unit for a reported measurement (given in the attribute "vädermått")..

hasSensitiveSpeciesAuthority.description: Indicates whether the user has any role with sensitive species observation authority.

hasSightingIndicationAuthority.description: Indicates whether the use user has any role with sighting indication authority.

viewAccess.description: User with sort > 0 is authorized to view the observation

hasSensitiveSpeciesAuthority.description: Indicates whether this role has sensitive species observation authority.

hasSightingIndicationAuthority.description: Indicates whether this role has sighting indication authority.

Visibility.description: States the visibility conditions during the survey event.

id.description:
If the entry exist in the vocabulary, then Id is greater than or equal to 0.
If the entry doesn't exist in the vocabulary, then Id is equal to -1.

VocabularyValue.description: Describes a value associated with a vocabulary.

WindStrength.description: States the strength of the wind during the survey event.

Bearer.description: JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme.
